Class GraphAL<D>

java.lang.Object
datastructure.graph.GraphAL<D>
Type Parameters:
D - type of the data object
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<D>
public class GraphAL<D> extends Object implements Graph<D>
Implementation using Adjacent Lists of a generic Graph data structure composed of vertexes of type VertexAL containing data objects and edges of type EdgeAL

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    protected int
    m
    number of edges
    protected int
    n
    number of vertexes
    protected ArrayList<VertexAL<D>>
    vertexes
    list of vertexes

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GraphAL()
    Constructs an empty graph implementated using adjacent lists; Cost: O(1)

    areAdjacent(Vertex<D> x, Vertex<D> y)
    Returns the edge connecting two given vertexes (returns null if the edge does not exist); Cost: O(δx), where δx is the out degree of x Worst-case: Θ(δx) Best-case: O(1)
    int
    edgeNum()
    Returns the number of edges of the graph; Cost: O(1)

    Returns the out degree of a vertex; Cost: O(1)

    outEdges(Vertex<D> v)
    Returns a list with the edges currently exiting from a given vertex; Cost: O(δv), where δv is the out degree of v
    void
    removeEdge(Edge<D> e)
    Remove an edge; Cost: O(δe.source), where δe.source is the out degree of the source vertex of the edge to remove Worst-case: Θ(δe.source) Best-case: O(1)
    void
    removeVertex(Vertex<D> v)
    Remove a vertex; Cost Θ(n+m), where n is the number of vertexes in the graph and m is the number of edges in the graph

    • areAdjacent

      public Edge<D> areAdjacent(Vertex<D> x, Vertex<D> y)
      Returns the edge connecting two given vertexes (returns null if the edge does not exist); Cost: O(δx), where δx is the out degree of x
      • Worst-case: Θ(δx)
      • Best-case: O(1)
      Specified by:
      areAdjacent in interface Graph<D>
      Parameters:
      x - source vertex
      y - destination vertex
      Returns:
      the edge connecting x and y (return null if x and y are not connected)

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a printable string representation of the Graph. For each vertex in the graph lists the adjacent vertexes; Cost Θ(n+m), where n is the number of vertexes in the graph and m is the number of edges in the graph
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string representation of the Graph
